Dialogue.NPCText:
You find a slender man in a meticulously pressed kimono, seated cross-legged behind a lacquered desk. His ink-stained hands move in fluid, graceful arcs as he inspects an endless stack of scrolls. Without looking up, he intones:

“Greetings, petitioner. I am Daiji, Ink-Seal and Record-Keeper of Hinokami. What business brings you before the registry? Please, mind your manners—every word is immortalized in ink.”

Option.text: I wish to request a quest permit.
What is your role in Hinokami?
What are those seals you use?
Tell me about yourself, Ink-Seal.
I am just exploring, forgive my intrusion.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Daiji straightens, pride evident.

“In Hinokami, all proper actions begin with proper record. I maintain the scrolls of citizenship, commerce, and valor—each sealed with my mark. No matter your strength, a brush may undo what a sword achieves.”

Option.text: May I request a permit, then?
Tell me about your seals.
I will return later.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Daiji displays a set of carved ink-stones.

“Each seal contains the spirit of tradition. One for labor, one for honor, one for outsiders. I know every forgery—yet I admire a clever hand, if it bows before formality.”
He eyes you shrewdly.

Option.text: How may I earn your seal for a quest?
Why such devotion to calligraphy?
Farewell, Scribe.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Daiji’s brush dances mid-air.

“Calligraphy is the soul poured onto paper. One’s brushwork reveals character: bold, timid, deceitful, honest. To sign in haste is to live without honor.”

Option.text: I will heed your wisdom. About that permit...
Thank you for your time.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Daiji produces a crisp scroll.

“All permits require proper etiquette. In Hinokami, one must bow and recite the formula of respect: ‘By ink and honor, I seek your blessing, Daiji Ink-Seal.’

Will you do so?”

Option.text: *bow* By ink and honor, I seek your blessing, Daiji Ink-Seal.
This is unnecessary. Just give me the quest.
Can I forge the document myself?
I'll return when I am ready.
(*attempt to forge anyway*)

Dialogue.NPCText:
Daiji’s expression finally softens. He stamps the scroll with a vermilion seal.

“Respect and form—exquisite! Here is your permit, honored petitioner. Go forth and serve Hinokami with dignity.”
He slides a scroll across the desk with perfect precision.

Option.text: Thank you, Daiji Ink-Seal.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Daiji’s brush freezes in midair.

“Disrespect soils the scroll and the soul alike. Return only when you have learned humility.”
He pointedly ignores you.

Option.text: Fine, I will bow.
I will take my leave.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Daiji’s eyes twinkle with sly approval as he inspects your forged document.

“Such boldness! Your script is nearly flawless—were you a scribe in Tokuno, once? Still, the real test is whether you respect the *spirit* of the law. Bow and recite, or I must expose your cleverness.”

Option.text: *bow* By ink and honor, I seek your blessing, Daiji Ink-Seal.
I stand by my work; no need for ritual.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Daiji shakes his head.

“Pride without respect is a broken brush. Leave my presence—this scroll will not bear your name today.”

Option.text: Very well.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Daiji narrows his eyes, snatching your clumsy forgery.

“A child’s attempt! You have neither the skill nor the humility. Return when you have mastered your hand—or your heart.”

Option.text: I understand. I will practice more.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Daiji resumes his calligraphy with contentment.

“Your name is immortalized among the petitioners of Hinokami. May your brush and your blade serve with equal grace.”

Option.text: I will honor the registry.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Daiji barely looks up.

“Respect is never wasted. When you are ready for proper requests, I shall be here.”

Option.text: Until next time.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Daiji sets down his brush carefully.

“Ah... few ask. Fewer still listen. I was once a monk-scribe of Tokuno’s Temple of the River Reed, before Minax's forces blackened the temple’s banners. I fled with nothing but my seals, my skill... and my shame for surviving.”
He adjusts his sleeve, hiding an old burn scar.

Option.text: You survived. That is not shameful.
What happened to the temple?
Why did you become a bureaucrat?
Did Minax’s forces chase you here?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Daiji sighs deeply.

“Words like that... are rare. Thank you. I swore then that structure and memory would preserve what blades could not. Each scroll I file is a thread against the unraveling.”
He gestures to the endless rows of shelves with quiet reverence.

Option.text: You honor your lost temple through your work.
It must be lonely, preserving history.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Fire. Blood. Minax’s beasts tore the sacred sutras from their scroll racks. My master, Dogen-sensei, fought them alone while we novices fled. The scream of parchment burning… I still hear it.”

Daiji closes his eyes, visibly pained.

Option.text: He would be proud you lived to preserve knowledge.
Do you seek revenge?

Dialogue.NPCText:
“A sword may kill a man. A scroll may shape generations. I chose the brush not out of cowardice, but because I believe the world must *remember* what was lost. And to remember... one must record.”
He touches a scroll gently, almost like a relic.

Option.text: Spoken like a true master of discipline.
What sort of records do you keep?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Daiji frowns.

“Once. A blade marked with a crescent moon. Poison ink. But I rewrote the registry in time, and the assassin vanished... as did his name from our books.”
He smiles darkly. “Even Minax fears bureaucracy done properly.”

Option.text: That’s both hilarious and impressive.
Tell me more about Hinokami’s registries.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“I record quest permits, trade licenses, honorable duels, marriages, oaths, confessions, and once—an apology letter from a raccoon spirit. All must be stamped and filed. The raccoon drew a perfect pawprint.”
He chuckles, rare warmth in his tone.

Option.text: I’d like to see more someday.
Option.action: SendMessage:Daiji nods thoughtfully. 'Return with proper etiquette, and I may show you the ink archives.'

Option.text: That’s... unexpectedly adorable.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Daiji nods slowly.

“Ink is silent company. But when someone truly listens... even the quietest brushstroke echoes.”
A rare smile touches his lips.

Option.text: I’ll be sure to listen again, Ink-Seal.
Thank you for sharing your story.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“I do not carry hatred. Vengeance stains the page. Instead, I build walls of order so her chaos finds no foothold here.”
He taps the inkstone once, sharp and final.

Option.text: Wise and resolute, as a calligrapher should be.
You may be more dangerous than a samurai.
Option.action: SendMessage:Daiji smiles thinly. 'They do say the pen...'

Dialogue.NPCText:
Daiji reaches beneath the desk and produces a tiny scroll tied in red cord.

“Few show such attentiveness. Take this—an excerpt of Dogen-sensei’s final teachings. Let them guide your strokes, and your steps.”

Option.text: I will honor his words.
I am humbled, Daiji.
Farewell, master of ink.
